Thanks for your interest in Success Academy! Running the largest, fastest-growing, and highest-performing network of public charter schools in New York City takes a village - families, children, teachers, staff and faculty, advocates and supporters alike. We would love to welcome you to our community! We work tirelessly every day to ensure each child in NYC has access to a fun, rigorous, whole-child education regardless of zip code or economic status. When you join SA, you play a part in giving every student who walks through the doors of one of our 53 schools in NYC a fair shot at reaching his or her potential.

Job Description


As the fastest-growing, highest-performing charter school network in New York State, Success Academy has reimagined public education. Nationally recognized for achieving outstanding academic results for students from all backgrounds and zip codes, we have created an innovative K-12 school model that is preparing current and future generations of children with the subject mastery and skills to succeed in college and life. We now need a qualified Associate/Specialist, Data Analyst (Ed Institute) to join our Education Institute department.

The Education Institute is our engine for reimagining public education within our schools and far beyond, and brings together a powerful K-12 focus across content and design, implementation, and instructional development.

As a critical member of our Education Institute department, a Associate/Specialist, Data Analyst (Ed Institute) will be an innovative thinker who will become an expert in the way we use data to visualize and measure learning in order to transform the daily experiences of teachers, school leaders, and district-level administrators – making their job easier, and thinking proactively about the kind of information that will enable them to drive results. The Associate/Specialist, Data Analyst (Ed Institute) will help instructional teams diagnose strengths and gaps in student achievement and help the Education Institute department train our teachers to create strong educational plans.

Qualifications:

0-3 years of professional experience, Bachelor’s degree preferred

Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, PowerPoint) with the ability to create complex formulas and build macros.

A passion for processes, and the ability to maintain strong systems

Strong organizational skills with a meticulous attention to detail

Strong work ethic and ability to work flexibly

A self-starter attitude, to independently and successfully manage projects

Great communication skills - quick to respond, both oral and written

Eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment!

Key Responsibilities Include:

Analyzing scholar and teacher data, assessing strengths and gaps across all schools

Reporting on internal and external school-based assessments to the Executive Team

Supporting the Content Design Team and Learning Quality Team, providing them with information and analytics in order to drive decisions across all schools

Building out the Education Institute’s data capabilities

To apply, please send a resume and cover letter outlining your candidacy. Resumes without cover letters will not be reviewed.

Job Description:

Seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst with experience in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies, Agile practices, and a deep understanding of the insurance industry, specifically in Property and Casualty (P&C) insurance Claims. As a Business Analyst in our team, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and IT solutions, ensuring the successful delivery of high-quality software projects within the insurance domain.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and document detailed business requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of business needs and objectives.

2. SDLC Expertise: Apply your in-depth knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies to guide projects from conception to implementation, ensuring alignment with business goals and industry best practices.

3. Experience with P&C insurance claims, such as Guidewire, Duck Creek, Insurity, Accenture Claim Components, Majesco, EIS Suite, StoneRiver, OneShield, Adaptik, Instec, Sapiens DECISION, Origami, Oceanwide, i2go, TIA Technology, Bolt Platform, Prima Solutions, Fineos, SimpliGov, Snapsheet.

4. Agile Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional Agile teams to facilitate effective communication, collaboration, and delivery. Use Agile principles to adapt to changing requirements and promote iterative development.

5. Insurance Industry Insight: Leverage your Insurance industry experience, specifically Insurance Claims, and understanding of insurance products, processes, and regulations to provide valuable insights and recommendations for system enhancements and optimizations.

6. Data Analysis: Analyze complex data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform business decisions. Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques is essential.

7. Documentation: Create comprehensive documentation including business requirements, user stories, process flows, and test cases. Ensure documentation is accurate, clear, and accessible to all stakeholders.

8. Stakeholder Management: Build strong relationships with business stakeholders, development teams, and other relevant parties. Act as a liaison between business units and IT, ensuring effective communication and alignment of objectives.

9. Quality Assurance: Collaborate with QA teams to develop and execute test plans, ensuring that solutions meet the specified requirements and are of high quality before deployment.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the insurance industry, specifically Insurance Claims.
Strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
Expertise in Agile frameworks and practices.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
Relevant certifications such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Agile certifications are a plus.

Overview:
Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.


At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community.
Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.

The Information Technology (IT) Solutions Analyst is responsible for matching potential technology solutions with defined business needs for incoming IT project requests for the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network. Provides quick response to business partners and facilitates getting the correct information for the Project Intake Process by working with the operational requestors, internal Information Technology (IT) division team members, and outside vendors. This includes ensuring that sufficient information regarding the high level project scope and level of effort is collected to allow requests to be reviewed by the appropriate governance team for approval, rejection, or additional scoping.

This position is hybrid with 2-4 times per month onsite. Ideal candidates should be able to pivot quickly to be onsite if the need arises.

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in gathering requirements for new/existing projects and has experience in the Healthcare industry.
Responsibilities:
A day in the life of a Information Technology (IT) Solutions Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
Liaise between the IT division, business and clinical operational areas, and technology vendors.
Understand current technology portfolio and standards across the network.
Recognize the need to develop a new technology standard.
Analyze business needs to understand requested project scope.
Assess IT resource needs and level of effort to support requested project scope.
Collaborate with Business Analyst to develop high level project cost information to inform the appropriate IT governing bodies.
Analyze the design of technical systems and business models.
Match technological solutions to business needs.
Produce reports on project intake queues and escalate as needed to eliminate delays in the intake process.
Analyze data to inform business decisions.
Assist with preparing and delivering project request presentations to appropriate IT governing bodies.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, management information systems, or other related field; or equivalent relevant experience may be accepted in lieu of a degree.
Minimum of 3 years of proven business analyst experience with a focus on project intake, resource estimation, demand management, project scoping or requirements definition.
Experience in facilitation of meetings related to project definition, reviews, decision-making, and other project related topics.
Working experience with deployments of production business or clinical applications, including in-house applications and third-party SaaS applications.
Experience with vendor management and communication.
Strong communication and presentation skills (oral and written) to shape messages to the appropriate level of audience.
Excellent problem-solving ability and critical thinking skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to understand complex business flows.
Ability to communicate complex technical information in an easy-to-understand way.
Strong organizational and project definition/scoping skills.
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
Experience in the Healthcare industry.
Experience with researching technology solutions.
Knowledge and ability to effectively utilize project portfolio management tools and Microsoft Office and/or Google Workplace tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Forms).
Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Licenses and Certifications Preferred:
PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or equivalent certification.
If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

Job Title: Senior Associate, Corporate Tax Lead Business Analyst (BA)
Job Description:
Overview
The Tax Compliance Quality Assurance (TCQA) Team is seeking a future team member for the role of Senior Associate, Lead Business Analyst. This role is located in New York, Hybrid.
The Business Analyst (BA) will interact with Business users, Relationship Managers, Senior Management, Operations, Technology and Support Teams regularly, to provide support for a newly launched U.S. Tax Form W-8/W-9 Documentation Tool. The BA will contribute to the continuous development and improvement of the Tool, set up grooming sessions to discuss future enhancements, and ensure rigorous testing is performed prior to any roll outs. The BA will also play a large role performing project management functions. Specifically, the BA will be tasked with driving business planning, ensuring projects stay on schedule and providing regular updates to the stakeholder community.

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document the ‘current state’ of tax functions/processes, and any BAU challenges.
Conduct independent reviews of business processes, data quality issues, and propose process improvements.
Draft business requirements, functional documents, and technical user stories.
Work closely with team members to develop test plans and create detailed test cases in JIRA
Assist with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and defect management.
Develop user manuals/documentation and provide training to stakeholders using the U.S. Tax Form W-8/W-9 Documentation Tool.
Assist with the onboarding and user provisioning of new clients to the U.S. Tax Form W-8/W-9 Documentation Tool.
Assist with data review and clean up exercises.
Lead periodic meetings with stakeholders and assist with updating monthly decks which includes timelines, project updates, accomplishments risks, issues, and dependencies.
Qualifications
Bachelor‘s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Familiarity with project management methodologies including Agile and Waterfall.
Good organizational and time management skills.
Experience leading requirement gathering sessions, taking meeting notes and documenting any new requirements from those sessions.
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Proficiency in MS Office suite.
Analytical skills and proficiency in analysing exceptionally large datasets.
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle
3-5 years of total work experience preferred.
1 - 5 years business/data analyst experience
1 - 5 years of project management experience

Preferred qualifications include experience/familiarity with:
Tax Information Reporting and Withholding (e.g., 1446f, FATCA, NRA, BUW, 8966 Reporting)
IRS Tax forms W-8/W-9, due diligence, and various tax onboarding, withholding reporting requirements.
Tax operating model transformation, including process improvements.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification and/or Prince2 certification
Experience with PowerBI, Power Query, UIPath,

Job Title: Data Analyst, Grants Management & Administration, Public Health Programs
Job Description:
Data Analyst, Grants Management & Administration, Public Health Programs

Are you seeking an opportunity to bring your professional expertise to a global organization focused on re-imagining public health?
The Data Analyst will collaborate with leadership across all programs within the Public Health, Environment/Climate/Urban Health, and Finance Divisions to identify, analyze, and convert existing programmatic and financial data into powerful reports and visualizations that enable analysis for decision-making in a timely manner. Under the supervision of the Director for Grants and Administration and as part of the Grants Management and Administration team, the Data Analyst will work with Power BI to develop and maintain reports and budget monitoring dashboards. The incumbent will be trusted to develop the appropriate data accession, normalization, and programming structure to enable reporting in Power BI and to develop visually useful dashboards. to respond to divisional needs and optimize divisional use.

Vital Strategies is an international public health organization. Our programs strengthen public health systems and address the world’s leading causes of illness, injury and death. We currently work in 73 countries, supporting data-driven decision making in government, advancing evidence-based public health policies, and mounting strategic communication campaigns. Vital Strategies’ priorities are driven by the greatest potential to improve and save lives. They include non-communicable disease prevention, tobacco control, road safety, obesity prevention, overdose prevention, environmental health, vital statistics systems building and multidrug-resistant tuberculosis treatment research. Our programs are primarily concentrated in low- and middle-income countries in Africa, Latin America, Asia and the Pacific; the Overdose Prevention Program is our first initiative in the U.S.

Vital Strategies is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive (DEI) organization. We believe our programs are strengthened when they are developed and supported by individuals with diverse life experiences, whose understanding of social and cultural issues can help make our work and workforce more inclusive. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or creed, gender, national origin, ancestry, actual or perceived age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, marital status, sexual orientation, predisposing genetic characteristics, alienage or citizenship status, gender (including gender identity or expression), partnership status, arrest or conviction record, status as a victim of domestic violence, status as a victim of sex offense or stalking, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.

Read about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and Vital Strategies: https://www.vitalstrategies.org/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-vital-strategies/

Job Purpose

The Data Analyst will collaborate with leadership across all programs within the Public Health, Environment/Climate/Urban Health, and Finance Divisions to identify, analyze, and convert existing programmatic and financial data into powerful reports and visualizations that enable analysis for decision-making in a timely manner. Under the supervision of the Director for Grants and Administration and as part of the Grants Management and Administration team, the Data Analyst will work with Power BI to develop and maintain reports and budget monitoring dashboards. The incumbent will be trusted to develop the appropriate data accession, normalization, and programming structure to enable reporting in Power BI and to develop visually useful dashboards. to respond to divisional needs and optimize divisional use.

This is a full-time position based in our New York office, where a hybrid, 2-day-per-week office schedule is in place. Vital Strategies offers highly competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits. The salary range for this position is $105,000 USD to $115,000 USD. The candidate must have authorization to work legally in the US at the time of hire.




Duties & Responsibilities

Oversee budget management dashboard development, forecasting, and maintenance across many distinct data sources, including the full-stack development of budget monitoring dashboards from data back-end (adapting, designing, and implementing data models, data tables, data pipelines, etc.) to user-facing front-end (user interfaces, dashboards, reports, tools, and visualizations) rendering.
Serve as internal consultant providing data-based recommendations and guidance to program leadership, and stakeholders in the areas of budget management/forecasting and programmatic data monitoring/evaluation/reporting via Power BI.
Work with the Grants Team, other division leaders, and staff within the organization as a Subject Matter Expert to assess data needs, troubleshoot issues with existing dashboards, and oversee identified design and data development issues.
Proactively meet with program staff to discern business problems and derive required reporting and dashboard requirements. Map out and develop dashboards, and any relevant back-end structures, based on business analysis.
Using data design best practices, collaborate with program staff to adapt and refine existing dashboards, reports, and tracking tools from other platforms (NetSuite, Excel, Smartsheet, etc.) into automated dashboards using data visualization and analysis tools like Power BI.
Perform data manipulation and cleansing to prepare datasets for implementation, reviewing for trends and patterns to draw conclusions, automate data flows, and improve data quality.
Works closely and collaboratively with program staff and other stakeholders to increase user adoption by enabling program staff to make efficient use of the reports and dashboards, providing technical support, guidance, training, and addressing any issues that may impede optimum usage.
Leads in the application of validation and QA efforts as they pertain to reporting, data, dashboard creation and execution, and dashboard quality.
Work with Grant Managers to complete quarterly reconciliation of accounting monthly close reports, submitted donor reports, and Power BI to ensure accuracy across all mediums.
Create processes and procedures to help the Grants Team streamline the completion of commonly requested and donor report generation for program inquiries.
Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented utilizing best practices in business intelligence and dashboard development.
Develop best practices, documentation standards, processes, and procedures for dashboard design and publishing, creating flowcharts and diagrams as required.
Monitor Power BI Service usage, and capacity in order to make recommendations for performance tuning, implementing performance improvements as appropriate.
Other duties as assigned by the Director.

Qualifications

Education & Degree

Bachelor’s degree in data science or data Analytics preferred.

Skills & Abilities

Knowledge and direct experience using Power BI (DAX functions, Power Query/M formula language).
Advanced understanding of database management system technology and architecture.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to effectively communicate with a range of stakeholders.
Ability to build strong, ongoing, impactful relationships at all organizational levels and across a diverse range of cultural, generational, ethnic, racial, educational, and social backgrounds.
Demonstrated commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment.

Experience Required:

Minimum 8 years of related work experience;
Experience with data management, data visualization, and statistical systems
Experience using Power BI (DAX functions, Power Query/M formula language),

Experience Preferred:

Knowledge and direct experience using NetSuite;
Knowledge and direct experience using related components of the Microsoft Power platform (i.e., Power Automate, Power Apps).
Programming experience with scripting languages (Python, R, etc.) for data analysis and visualization.
Experience writing and reviewing SQL queries in any dialect.
Interest and/or experience in grants management.
Prior experience working in non-profit, grants, or finance sectors.

Job Description

***We prefer candidates in New York. They can work remote but would need to work from the New York office as required.*****

Under general supervision, this position has lead responsibilities for accessing, integrating, various data compilation, data management, data analysis, data quality controls and reporting from various Molina systems (e.g., QNXT, Salesforce) and/or related external systems (e.g. industry). The Data Analyst will be responsible to provide insight into data trends, drawing broad conclusions and create actionable comprehensive business management reporting that can be used to identify opportunities to improve operational outcomes, business strategies, data quality and ensure data governance principles, rules, use and practices are maintained as the organization scales in staff and membership number. This position will conduct exploratory and discovery studies that include assessing requirements, in depth strategic and tactical market, membership, and provider analytics, including enrollment, retention as well as demographic, behavioral, competitive and economic trends in support of Growth Group units including: Sales/Sales Ops, Retention, Marketing and Community Engagement as well as Provider Services. Additional analytics include current state membership gap analyses, comparison to best practices and presenting the finding and recommendations to senior management in a clear, concise and insightful manner. The Data Analyst will run investigative queries, when appropriate, collaborate with other Plan and shared services resources/personnel to identify root causes and solutions to data, analytical and business planning issues. This resource may also be utilized for ad hoc management data and reporting requests and/or assistance with special project management activities. Additional responsibilities may include creating presentations and other collateral in support of those same business requests.

JOB DUTIES (Main duties & responsibilities of the role):
Prepare well organized, easily understood reports, analysis, and summary of findings for use by management

Work with internal, external and enterprise individuals as needed to research, develop and document new standard reports or processes.

Consolidate data from multiple sources using industry based tools or manually be able to process and profile data.

Support team members and others when additional analytics are required.

Participates in special projects and initiatives that are designed to improve data quality.

Keeps abreast of industry best business practices and makes suggestions to management on how to improve current practices.

Performs special projects upon request.

Extract and compile various sources of information and large data sets from various systems or applications.

Prepare State-mandated reports/Analysis as indicated.

Develop test plans and test cases, report test results and test analysis; analyze and recommend improvements based on testing results.

Develop and demonstrate ongoing support data controls that detect data defects.

Set up process for monitoring, tracking and trending information and data using various systems or applications.

Gather and monitor Data Quality KPIs in relation to Master Data Management requirements and Data Quality Controls tolerances

Research perform profiling tasks on data quality dimensions and analyze report results identifying opportunities and trends

Medicaid Industry Knowledge strongly desired

Requires Strong/Expert Excel skills and comfortable with dynamic scenario modelling

Must be proficient in SQL and Databricks.

Require Strong skills in the use of PowerPoint and MS products

Pay Range: $ 60,414 - $117,808 a year*


Actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level.

Job Title: Specialist, Business of IT Product / Business Analyst (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our Company IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Specialist, Product/Business Analyst is an entry-level role within IT Strategy Realization. This individual will support the analysis of business needs and assist in the development of digital and technology solutions. The Specialist will report to the Associate Director of Product/Business Analyst and will contribute to the achievement of our Company's IT Strategy goals.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Assist in gathering and documenting business requirements.

Perform basic analysis of existing business processes.

Support the design and development of digital and technology solutions.

Conduct research to gather information on industry trends and best practices.

Assist in project management tasks such as timeline tracking and resource coordination.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver project milestones.

Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry developments.

Support the execution of training programs for stakeholders.

Limited travel may be required.

High School Diploma required.

1+ years of experience in business analysis, product management, or a related field (internships and entry-level positions can be counted).

Basic understanding of business processes.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Good communication and teamwork skills.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

Interest in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.

Experience with business process modeling.

Experience with developing user stories.

Experience with user-centric design.

Understanding of organizational change management principles.

Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools is a plus.

Experience working within a product organization.

U.S. Hybrid Work Model

Effective September 5, 2023, employees in office-based positions in the U.S. will be working a Hybrid work consisting of three total days on-site per week, generally Tuesday, Wednesday and either Monday or Thursday, although the specific days may vary by site or organization, with Friday designated as a remote-working day, unless business critical tasks require an on-site presence. This Hybrid work model does not apply to, and daily in-person attendance is required for, field-based positions; facility-based, manufacturing-based, or research-based positions where the work to be performed is located at a Company site; positions covered by a collective-bargaining agreement (unless the agreement provides for hybrid work); or any other position for which the Company has determined the job requirements cannot be reasonably met working remotely. Please note, this Hybrid work model guidance also does not apply to roles that have been designated as “remote”.

Job Title: Business Analyst & System Administration - Workplace Technology - Workplace Operations & Supply Chain
Job Description:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What's the role?

Workplace Operations & Supply Chain, through our services and applications provide an employee experience that drives innovation, collaboration, productivity, and transparency. Our Global Employee Operations Team is central to this effort by providing platinum support to 21,000 employees and over 500,000 annual visitors in over 170 state-of-the-art offices worldwide!?

We are a close-knit, hardworking team who rely upon a complex set of proprietary and third-party systems to deliver the services we provide; and those systems are the key to understanding where we are successful, and where we can develop. ?The team strives to continually improve and elevate the employee experience, while continually improving operationally. ?

Our 21,000 employees generate more than 550,000 service requests each year through a ticketing system and chat that drives both human and automated services related to Employee Operations, Workplace Operations and Supply Chain employee support and internal cross departmental workflows. ?Support Services through these systems are comprised of supporting approximately 400+ software titles, monitoring our entire corporate network that consists of 28,000 PCs with peripherals, 50,000 screen displays and 120,000 network connections; enhancing and maintaining our 170 offices globally, overseeing over 7,000 moves annually; and the Planning, Manufacturing, Logistics, and Warehousing from 22 global locations to distribute equipment to over 190 countries.?
?
We are looking for a Business Analyst to identify. develop, implement, and drive strategic initiatives globally that automate processes and workflows for the products and services we provide to support employees. More specifically, leveraging Bloomberg developed no code/low code tools to orchestrate service request automation and digital process transformation, and continuous improvement initiatives across employee support workflows.

This individual is responsible for assessing the internal and external factors that can affect project outcomes, leverage problem solving skills to ensure project plans deliver on time as well as work with stakeholders to inform the strategy and roadmap for technology initiatives. In addition, overseeing all aspects of a project such as timelines, scope, requirements, and sprint management to ensure the initiatives stay on track.?

We'll trust you to:
Through an agile framework, deliver system workflow changes, taking a hands-on approach to driving incremental change and improvements
Manage system enhancement requests that streamline product and workflow problems, make decisions, and prioritize work to stay on track towards business deliverables?
Responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of our e-Builder® Construction Management System and other Integrated Workplace Management Systems (IWMS)
Coordination and delivery of training including content and materials
Develop a roadmap for automation opportunities-Leverage data/evidence-driven approach to determine project success criteria, monitor results, and measure impact
Communicate with and manage business and cross departmental stakeholders at all levels
Leverage your customer service skills to provide customer service to Workplace Operation employees via our internal ticketing system

Role/Title – IT Business Analyst III


Description:

The primary responsibilities will include:

Eliciting business requirements from business users and subject matter experts, define and document requirements, write functional specifications, and perform business process design in conjunction with operations teams.

Serve as liaison between the internal/external business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.

Lead requirements validation and traceability analysis, manage scope and requirements throughout the project lifecycle, Lead development of common standards and tools, Assist in operational rollout and support, and Translates business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization.


Additional responsibilities will include:

Gather requirements from the business line users for various systems.

Fully document all requirements and solutions. Liaise with internal and external technology partners.

Work closely with administration, technology, and operations partners.

Participate in releases, perform system integration testing.

Perform/organize user acceptance testing.

Prepare project status reports for Senior Management.

Use strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with particular emphasis on the production of clear and detailed written Business Requirements and Functional Specifications.

Requires ability to work independently (self-motivated) and with a distributed team (i.e., physically located in other regions).

Must build and maintain strong relationships with business and technology partners; Understand and analyse business processes & workflows.

Requires understanding of the Structured Finance business and an interest to further develop this knowledge.

10-15 years of relevant work experience required.


Must have:

10+ years of Regulatory trade reporting experience.

Regulations covered are Dodd-Frank, EMIR, MiFID, MAS, HKMA.

Position Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree from an accredited educational institution, in fields such as public administration, business, mathematics, data science, economics, accounting, the social sciences, or other related business or operational field. Master’s degree is a plus.
Minimum of six (6) years of experience in performance auditing, evaluation, oversight, or a project management-focused field. Applicant’s work experience sufficiency is evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
Knowledge of acceptable audit industry standards, processes, and procedures.
Demonstrated analytical skills, critical thinking skills, impartial judgment, and research aptitude.
Excellent oral skills for interviewing, experience a plus.
Excellent writing skills for documenting interviews, summarizing evaluation findings, and drafting reports.
Ability to gather and interpret high volumes of complex data.
Excellent working knowledge of computer application relevant to auditing, including Microsoft Office. Advanced Excel is a plus.
Ability to handle multiple projects while maintaining careful attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to interact effectively with department and agency staff and senior management.
Travel within the MTA geographic jurisdiction will be required.
Working outside of regular business hours may be required.
Pursuant to authorization by the EDIG/Audit, this position is eligible for tele-working according to office policies.


Duties Description
Responsibilities:


Conducts multiple audits simultaneously, focused on complex, multifaceted topics.
Evaluates agency or program performance using qualitative and quantitative methods to determine expectations/standards, problems, causal factors, and options to correct.
Reviews agency processes, procedures, and controls designed to manage and mitigate risk, fraud, waste, and abuse of agency resources.
Identifies issues and develops a plan to assess their significance.
Conducts interviews of agency and other personnel and prepares clear and concise interview memoranda.
Develops appropriate recommendations to improve agency operations, cost-efficiency, and safety.
Prepares professionally written reports on the areas evaluated.
Provides leadership, direction, and feedback to junior staff on the team.
Manages and prioritizes assigned audits to meet project milestones.
Develops and maintains professional working relationships and continually gains knowledge of evolving MTA and agency operations.
Works in a team environment to identify issues and develop methodology to assess their significance.
Analyzes data using a variety of software to identify risks.
Supports investigative cases with analysis or participates as part of the investigative team, as assigned.
Other duties as assigned by the EDIG/Audit or designee.

English
We Offer



Credit Suisse Asset Management is a leading investment manager with 420Bn assets under management. As part of a global delivery team, you will be responsible for analysis and providing solutions to trading team in implementing new workflows and help with trading new asset types. You will be expected to have an excellent written and verbal communicator with a good knowledge of trading systems and various asset types and have confidence in working with IT colleagues and Operations counterparts across all levels of the organization. You will be responsible for authoring business requirements articulating required changes as agreed with assigned business groups, functional changes that translate the requirements into cohesive system changes for implementation by the technical teams and UAT test cases, execution strategy and test summary documentation to validate the changes implemented. You will possess the qualities to be able to lead other Business Analysts on larger projects and take accountability for their respective workload and deliveries.




Your future colleagues

You would be joining the Asset Management IT team, we provide the best-in-class trading, risk, CRM and data solutions to the bank. Our systems support the division that is specialized in providing various alternative investment solutions to the clients. You would be working with some of the best-in-class people from business as well IT that supports the Asset Management division.




Credit Suisse Group AG has been acquired by UBS Group AG. Credit Suisse continues its business activities as a subsidiary company of UBS Group AG, including selective hiring for experienced professionals.



You Offer


Hands on, working experience with any Trading Application/System.
Hands on working knowledge on Charles River platform, or similar Order management systems.
Understanding of technical systems and an ability to write queries in SQL to address business are required.
An in-depth understanding of various asset types such as Equities, Futures, Fixed Income securities and Derivatives (Swaps).
BA experience in the financial services industry, specifically trading systems with a proven delivery record in a global environment
Detailed understanding of full project life cycle and development process in both Waterfall and Agile projects. Align with CS standards and guidelines for delivery.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skill, able to target material and message to a wide variety of audiences at all levels in the organization. Ability to communicate complex issues clearly and effectively.
Deep understanding of technical ‘building blocks’ in IT, with ability to constructively challenge application owners / technical leads on their plans, assumptions, and estimates, to drive enhanced and forward-thinking solutions.
Results oriented with excellent problem-solving skills, structured and analytical approaches, organizational ability, outstanding attention to detail, ability to multi-task, strong time management skills and positive attitude to problem solving and delivery in a team within a matrix-based organization.
Professional team-player, highly collaborative, delivery focused, and deadline driven. Comfortable with challenging peers to bring out the best in a project team.
Experience of driving and consolidating analysis across a wide range of projects to enable standardization and prevent duplicated efforts.
Good experience in analyzing and defining front-to-back business process workflows and ability to understand system technical flows.
Liaise between the buy-side trading desks and development teams to facilitate the delivery of application enhancement projects for the Asset Management trading platform.

Preferred skills include:

Techno functional role (with experience in .NET and SQL) will be preferred given the integration with UBS
Experience on working with various asset types such as Equities, Futures, Fixed Income securities and Derivatives
Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

Business operations

The associate is regularly required to apply manual dexterity, including hand/wrist flexibility, for computer keyboarding. The associate is frequently required to hear and speak to use the telephone, make presentations and communicate with people in an office or virtual environment. Mount Sinai advances health for all people, everywhere, by taking on the most complex health care challenges of our time — discovering and applying new scientific learning and knowledge; developing safer, more effective treatments; educating the next generation of medical leaders and innovators; and supporting local communities by delivering high-quality care to all who need it. The Health System includes approximately 7,400 primary and specialty care physicians; 13 joint-venture outpatient surgery centers throughout the five boroughs of New York City, Westchester, Long Island, and Florida; and more than 30 affiliated community health centers. Newsweek’s “The World’s Best Smart Hospitals” ranks The Mount Sinai Hospital as No. 1 in New York and in the top five globally, and Mount Sinai Morningside in the top 20 globally.

Job Title: 2024 University Recruiting - Global Workplace & Enterprise Services Environmental, Health & Safety Data Analyst Co-op
Job Description:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team as a Co-op Data Analyst to support our organization's data analytics efforts and Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) initiatives. In this role, you will utilize your skills in data analytics, Power BI, and EHS to gather, analyze, and visualize data, enabling evidence-based decision-making and ensuring compliance with EHS regulations. You will work closely with various stakeholders to identify data needs, develop analytics solutions, and provide actionable insights to drive operational excellence.

Responsibilities

Data Analytics:

Collect and organize data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and integrity.

Perform advanced analytics and statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

Develop data models and conduct data mining to discover opportunities or areas of improvement.

Apply data validation techniques to identify data quality issues and recommend solutions.

Transform complex data into easily understandable reports, dashboards, and visualizations.

Power BI:

Utilize Power BI toolset to create interactive visualizations and reports for data-driven decisions.

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and create visually compelling dashboards.

Develop custom Power BI components, such as DAX queries, calculated tables, and measures.

Optimize performance and maintain data models within the Power BI platform.

Provide training and support to end-users to maximize their understanding and use of Power BI.

Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS):

Support EHS initiatives by collecting, analyzing, and reporting relevant data.

Assist in the development and implementation of EHS programs and policies.

Conduct risk assessments, incident investigations, and audits as needed.

Ensure compliance with EHS regulations and internal standards.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and mitigate EHS risks.

Educational Requirements:

Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Environmental Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.

Skills and Qualifications:

Strong knowledge and experience in data analytics, statistical analysis, and data visualization.

Proficient in using tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Excel, SQL, or other database management systems.

Familiarity with EHS regulations, guidelines, and best practices.

Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.

Attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality work.

Job Title: Senior Transportation Scheduling and Data Analyst - NYC Ferry
Job Description:
Salary $90,000

NYC Ferry operated by Hornblower is seeking a Senior Transportation Scheduling and Data Analyst for our operation in Brooklyn, NY.

About You:

This person will be adaptable, dynamic, and embody City Experiences’ RESPECT Service System.

About the Opportunity:

The Transportation Scheduling and Data Analyst plays a crucial role in managing and optimizing transportation processes, as well as contributing to data-driven decision-making within Hornblower’s Ferry and Transportation Division. This consists of designing processes to collect accurate -related data, which includes data on routes, vehicle performance, fuel consumption, maintenance, compliance, and other relevant elements. This role ensures that the data is accurate, up-to-date, and consistent, allowing the organization to make informed decisions and optimize transportation operations. You will collaborate with various departments to understand their data needs, create interactive dashboards, and provide insights that contribute to business objectives.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Develop transportation routes and schedules for the Ferry and Transportation division.
Optimize routes to minimize fuel consumption, reduce transit times, and maximize resource utilization, depending on the priorities of the relevant contracting agency.
Ensure adherence to delivery timelines and service level agreements are met.
Collect and compile transportation-related data from various sources, such as GPS systems, sensors, databases, and reports.
Analyze transportation data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, and develop insights to improve operations.
Create reports, charts, and visualizations to present data findings to senior management and stakeholders in an understandable and actionable manner.
Regularly review and clean transportation data to identify and correct errors, anomalies, or inconsistencies. Validate data against real-world performance and compliance standards.
Integrate transportation data from multiple sources and systems to create a centralized and comprehensive data repository.
Maintain and update transportation databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Develop models and algorithms to optimize transportation routes, schedules, and resource allocation.
Identify opportunities to reduce transportation costs and improve cost-efficiency through data analysis.
Ensure transportation operations comply with relevant regulations and standards by monitoring data for compliance issues.
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish performance benchmarks for all respective departments.
Provide actionable recommendations and strategies based on data analysis to improve transportation efficiency and decision-making.
Implement and manage transportation management software and systems.
Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in transportation management.
Ensure data security and privacy measures are in place to protect sensitive data.
Maintain documentation of data quality procedures, standards, and workflows.
Provide training and support to staff involved in data entry and maintenance. Collaborate with various departments to ensure data quality standards are met.
Additional job duties assigned.

Requirements & Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, business analytics and or mathematics or a related field (master's degree may be preferred in some cases).
SQL database management.
Python coding.
Proficiency in various data analysis tools and software is essential. These may include:
Programming Languages: Python, R, or SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Data Visualization Tools: Tableau, or Power BI for creating data visualizations.
Statistical Software: Such as SAS, SPSS, or Stata for statistical analysis.
Data Query Languages: Like SQL for database querying.
Data Cleaning and Transformation: Ability to clean and preprocess raw data for analysis, handling missing data, and transforming it into a usable format.
Statistical Analysis: Understanding of statistical methods and techniques, including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and predictive modeling.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in creating clear and insightful data visualizations to communicate findings effectively via Tableau.
Database Management: Knowledge of database systems and the ability to work with data stored in databases.
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and tools, especially for roles that involve predictive analytics.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for basic data analysis and reporting.
Proven experience in data analysis and problem solving.
Strong leadership skills.
Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Knowledge of inventory management software and systems.
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Familiarity with safety and compliance regulations.

About Us:

City Experiences’ passion is to provide amazing experiences on land and water. Our 40-year success through organic growth and acquisitions has resulted in a portfolio of over 25+ brands that welcome upwards of 30 million guests/riders annually. If you’re an enthusiastic team player who thrives in an environment where communication, creativity, and cooperation are encouraged, this may just be the opportunity for you.

Company Name: Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc.
Job Description:
POSITION ANNOUNCEMENT

Data Analyst, Youth Mental Health

Salary Grade: 23

$80,721 -$94,822

The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. is seeking one (1) qualified candidate to fill the full-time position Data Analyst, Youth Mental Health in the bureau of Children, Youth, and Families.

DIVISION/PROGRAM DESCRIPTION:

Our Agency's five strategic priorities, building off a recently-completed strategic planning process emerging from the COVID-19 emergency, are: 1) To re-envision how the Health Department prepares for and responds to health emergencies, with a focus on building a "response-ready" organization, with faster decision-making, transparent public communications, and stronger surveillance and bridges to healthcare systems 2) Address and prevent chronic and diet-related disease, including addressing rising rates of childhood obesity and the impact of diabetes, and transforming our food systems to improve nutrition and enhance access to healthy foods 3) Address the second pandemic of mental illness including: reducing overdose deaths, strengthening our youth mental health systems, and supporting people with serious mental illness 4) Reduce black maternal mortality and make New York a model city for women's health 5) Mobilize against and combat the health impacts of climate change Our 7,000-plus team members bring extraordinary diversity to the work of public health. True to our value of equity as a foundational element of all of our work, and a critical foundation to achieving population health impact in New York City, the NYC Health Department has been a leader in recognizing and dismantling racism's impacts on the health of New Yorkers and beyond. In 2021, the NYC Board of Health declared racism as a public health crisis. With commitment to advance anti-racist public health practices that dismantle systems that perpetuate inequitable power, opportunity and access, the NYC Health Department continues to work in and with communities and community organizations to increase their access to health services and decrease avoidable health outcomes.

BUREAU DESCRIPTION:

The Bureau of Children, Youth & Families (CYF) is responsible for planning and monitoring much of NYC's comprehensive network of child and adolescent community mental health services. CYF relies on research and surveillance to guide its decisions around service planning, implementation and evaluation and incorporates a health equity lens into its work. CYF oversees a portfolio of over 100 programs and supports a family-driven, individualized and strength-based approach to care.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Bureau is seeking to hire a Data Analyst for Youth Mental Health (YMH) to assist with the analysis of program and population survey data relating to youth mental health. The Data Analyst for YMH will report to the Data Manager for Youth Mental Health in the Office of Research and Evaluation, and work closely with the Division of Epidemiology to ensure that youth mental health survey, analytic, and reporting efforts are aligned with program goals and objectives. The Office of Research and Evaluation (ORE) supports Bureau Offices and leadership by conducting surveillance, needs assessment research, program evaluation and reporting, and general research and data support. ORE plays a central role in the development and management of data collection systems and analysis of population-level and program-specific data. In addition, it informs the public through publications and presentations. The Data Analyst for YMH will assist with the data capture, analysis and reporting of parent and youth-reported mental health survey data. They will assist with the development of recommendations to help increase the reach of the YMH data and future survey and analytic efforts. The Data Analyst for YMH will also work collaboratively with other research staff in CYF, as well as across the agency to analyze and report on DOHMH population-level survey data relevant to youth mental health.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Participate in and assist the Data Manager for Youth Mental Health with the planning, development, and implementation of population level youth mental health data surveillance and research.
Assist with the development and maintenance of youth mental health survey research conducted at DOHMH in collaboration with bureau, divisional, and cross-divisional partners.
Assist with the identification of appropriate survey instruments and design new items for future surveys.
Maintain strong knowledge of the landscape of youth mental health to inform research efforts; and conduct literature reviews as needed.
Work with the Data Manager for Youth Mental Health to develop analytic strategies and plan for youth mental health data.
Design, conduct, and interpret the youth mental health complex surveydatasets and others as they relate to youth mental health (NYC Kids, YRBS, Neighborhood Wellness)
Identify and evaluate the prevalence, patterns and trends of youth mental health outcomes, predictors, and associated social factors.
Work with the division of Epidemiology to support the implementation and data capture for the bi-annual youth mental health survey.
In collaboration with the division of Epidemiology, pre-process, clean, and prepare data for analysis using SAS, SUDAAN, and/or R. Specific tasks include:
Clean raw datasets, including recoding and renaming variables, adding labels and formats, and removing unused variables.
Merge datasets and append variables
Create codebooks, analytic guidelines and other dataset documentations
Lead data management efforts through data quality review and thorough documentation of data management decisions, in collaboration with the Data Manager for Youth Mental Health.
Ensure rapid and accurate response to internal and external requests for data, ensuring data and reports are reviewed prior to sending.
Develop graphics, tables, and slides to be used for presentations to a wide set of audiences.
Effectively present and interpret data findings verbally, in writing and in table format to internal and external stakeholders.
Assist with the writing of technical and research publications based on findings from the above analyses for internal and external stakeholders.
Assist with the writing and analyses needed for a Youth Mental Health bi-annual status report.
Conduct literature reviews to inform research questions, analysis design and outcome measures.
Collaborate with other research analysts, program, and policy staff.
Conduct special projects and perform other duties as assigned.
Incorporate anti-racist research practices to promote equitable data collection, analysis, reporting and technical assistance.
Ensure alignment with Bureau and Divisional data protocols and stay current with emerging trends and practices in youth mental health survey design, implementation, and reporting.
Protect the confidentiality of private information and follow study protocols

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

A Master's degree or equivalent related experience in Psychology, Social Work, Public Heath, Public Administration, Public Policy, or an associated field.

OR:

Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two (2) years of satisfactory and relevant professional experience working in one or a combination of the following areas: management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research, or program evaluation; in personnel or public administration, economic planning, or fiscal management; or a related area, AND:
Two or more years of proven, successful, Project Management experience.

PREFERRED SKILLS:

The successful candidate will have strong analytic and statistical skills with the ability to manipulate and analyze data using statistical software.
Proficiency in the use of SAS; at least two years' experience preferred.
Previous work with SUDAAN, SQL, a plus
Experience cleaning raw data and an excellent attention to detail
A background with research, survey development and implementation, data analysis, and reporting is desirable.

Location: 42-09 28th Street, Long Island City, NY 11101

Salary: $82,506 - $94,882

Remote Work Policy: DOHMH employees working through RFMH are allowed a Hybrid option post training and onboarding.

RFMH employees may be required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 depending on work location and must provide proof of vaccination. Individuals that are not vaccinated for COVID-19 are ineligible for appointment to positions that require vaccination. Fully vaccinated is defined as two (2) or more weeks since receiving either the second dose in a two-dose COVID-19 vaccination series (e.g., Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna) or the first and only dose of a single-dose vaccine (e.g., Johnson & Johnson [J&J]/Janssen).

The Mission of the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is to promote the mental health of all New Yorkers, with a focus on providing hope and supporting recovery for adults with serious mental illness and children with serious emotional disturbances. Applicants with lived mental health experience are encouraged to apply. RFMH is deeply committed to supporting underserved individuals, organizations, and communities. To this end, RFMH is focused on implementing activities and initiatives to reduce disparities in access, quality, and treatment outcomes for underserved populations. A critical component of these efforts is ensuring that RFMH is a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees' unique attributes and skills are valued and utilized to support the mission of the Agency. RFMH is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York. Job Title: Senior PACS Administrator (Clinical Business Analyst Lvl 3), Clinical Information Systems
Job Description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals



Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description



The Senior PACS Administrator will be responsible for day-to-day support, liaise between IT and business, to gather projects scope requirements, design and technical documents, implementation planning, coordinate with vendors, support the department and/or staff training programs to meet the needs of radiological & medical imaging services for the organization.

Duties & Responsibilities
Supports the day-to-day operation of all current Radiology Information System and applications, including but not limited to the picture archiving and communication system (PACS), the radiology information system (RIS), PowerScribe (voice recognition) and other advanced radiology and/or imaging applications.
Coordinate with Radiology and HIT users, stakeholders, sponsors to assess departmental needs, designing, building and testing solutions that improve the clinicians work flow and build functional requirements.
Provide management and/or supervision of staff and or projects.
Develop documentation of test plans, technical documentation, release notes, end-user guides, and training programs and/or other materials as necessary.
Maintain software documentation and dictionary tables and definitions for applications.
Proactively communicate status of key activities, risks, and issues to the project manager as needed.
Respond to user request, record and troubleshoot system trends and affect corrective action plans; track, communicate software problems and issues to software development, support teams and/or vendor.
Coordinates new DICOM modality connections and analyzes HL7 interface transactions to validate data workflow. Understands integration design among multi-platform systems.
Help develop & implement best practices and standards in radiology and imaging processes.
Guide separate radiology systems integration into a single platform, tightly integrated with multiple EHR; as H+H uses multiple instances of Q-CPR and moving into a single Epic system.
Researches industry practices; collects and analyzes data or information; draws appropriate conclusion and recommendations; presents results in written reports or through oral presentations using visual aids.
Participates in budget related activities such as developing and monitoring budget, compiling data, monitoring expenses, responding to inquiries, providing documentation, explaining variances, and providing rationale and recommendations.
Monitors status, identifies trends, and prepares reports on quality measures, performance metrics, or other department goals and objectives.
Manages, coordinates, or conducts activities related to identifying and managing project risks: such as compliance activities, testing and documentation, information security awareness, adherence, and risk management process; and business continuity.
Leads or completes ad-hoc projects and/or assignments.

Coordinate user groups and project teams, convening conference calls and meetings, and maintaining minutes and follow-up logs.
Create management tools within the applications through reports, graphs, pivot charts and other mechanisms to assist in decision making.
Support the creation and development of new interfaces with external systems, including ongoing review of data integrity within existing clinical and financial system interfaces.

Manage & maintain user management process and procedures consistent with H+H policies and procedures.
Due to the responsibilities of this position, employee will be required to work beyond the regularly scheduled hours/tour (i.e. as needed for off-hours implementations to best accommodate the clinical department operations & clinical care, respond to urgent issues during off-hours support program, etc.)
Provide exceptional customer service, build a great working relationship with customers, vendors, and management.
Performs other duties as assigned/required.

Strong analytical and problem solving abilities.

Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We’re building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve.

Job Summary

Become a driving force in the transformation of video content analytics and join Altice USA to help craft the next chapter of customer engagement and retention. As Senior Analyst of Programming Analytics, reporting to the VP of Programming and Content Analytics, this role is pivotal in refining our understanding of customer interactions and engagement with ATUS’s video content. You’ll dive deep into data-driven analytics, uncovering key insights that inform our content strategy, ensuring optimal engagement and customer retention. You’ll collaborate with a diverse team of experts, leveraging statistics, analytics, and machine learning technologies to help understand, quantify, and predict the relationships between our customers and our video content.

Responsibilities
Data Analytics: Leverage statistics and data science to create models and analyze vast datasets, focusing on customer viewing habits and preferences.
Content Analysis: Evaluate the interplay between content engagement and customer behavior, providing insights to optimize both viewing experiences and content strategy.
Customer Segmentation: Develop segmentation, classification, and statistical analyses to measure the impact of carriage to CLV among different sets of customers.
Collaboration: Work hand-in-hand with the Data Warehousing, Data Science, Product and Content Teams to transform data insights into actionable strategies.
Insights: Leverage the latest in cloud technologies to amplify your analytical depth, especially focused on applied machine learning.
Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Industry: 2+ years in a data or analytics role, preferably within video content, media, or technology sectors.
Technical: Expertise in SQL is a must, coupled with proficiency in Python or R. Experience working in a cloud data environment, with proven experience leveraging cloud technologies within analytics, machine learning, and data engineering, and experience correlating multiple data sets across different reporting assets.
Growth: Growth mindset and mentally primed to take on challenges and adopt effective problem-solving strategies.
Organizational Mastery: Strong personal organizational and time management skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and ensure quality reporting.

Life at UiPath:
The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose

Could that be you?
Overview:

The Intelligent Automation Business Analyst will work with Global Process Owners and Subject Matter Experts to define and explore processes for intelligent automation. Collect and validate relevant process metrics. Uncover pain points and improvement opportunities. Define requirements and “to be” state solutions by working and communicating with various parts of the business. Encourage customer teams to optimize and build new solutions to improve quality of service. Promote digital innovation to transform the way people work and improve experience of services. Support customers in using automation as a key enabler to achieve defined business outcomes.


This is a remote role located anywhere in the US.

What you'll do at UiPath:
Provide functional and operational recommendations to internal functional teams & business stakeholders
Review and help refine automation business cases to optimize, improve and automate business processes to deliver the desired business outcome
Help create an automation pipeline to ensure adoption of UiPath automation capabilities to drive automation strategy and growth
Conduct high-level assessment, detail As-Is process description, detail To-Be automated process description and define quantifiable business cases with a sound understanding of UiPath products and platform.
Work with internal functional teams and business stakeholders to extract use cases in their existing implementations
Partner with Solution Architect to create an implementation plan for the automation solutions designed and work closely with Automation Developers through to testing and deployment.
Help improve industry points of view with practical implementation & adoption experiences
Participate or lead workshops to help shape best fit solution for a certain process areas
Interact with business stakeholders and subject matter experts to present automation sources of value in the chosen process areas
Solve day-to-day issues arising during automation projects with timely resolutions.
Facilitate daily stand-up meetings on behalf of project manager and coordinate with internal functional teams and business stakeholders regularly for scope clarifications.
Help identify reusable solutions
Act as a communication bridge between CoE and the business stakeholders
Develop success stories and case studies from internal implementation and adoption of UiPath automation capabilities to be shared with rest of organization
What you'll bring to the team:
Bachelor’s degree in business, management information systems, or related fields
Experience with Business Process Automation required; UiPath experience preferred
3 years experience management consulting customer-facing role (Required)
Knowledge and experience with business and data analysis (Required)
Experience with large transformational engagement (Preferred)
Start-up type experience (Preferred), with the ability to operate in a fluid and dynamic environment

Skills & Methodologies:

Negotiation, influencing, and presentation skills
Detail oriented and a self-starter
Elicitation methodologies (Interviews, brainstorming, workshop facilitation, observation, surveys, story board)
Process mapping & diagrams drawing methodologies (BPMN)
Process improvement methodologies (LSS)
Prioritization methodologies (Ranking, Numerical assignment, MoScoW)

Job Title: Data Analyst, Schooling Data and Analytics
Job Description:
Thanks for your interest in Success Academy! Running the largest, fastest-growing, and highest-performing network of public charter schools in New York City takes a village - families, children, teachers, staff and faculty, advocates and supporters alike. We would love to welcome you to our community! We work tirelessly every day to ensure each child in NYC has access to a fun, rigorous, whole-child education regardless of zip code or economic status. When you join SA, you play a part in giving every student who walks through the doors of one of our 53 schools in NYC a fair shot at reaching his or her potential.

Job Description

This school year marks the 18th anniversary of Success Academies and the launch of our mission to reimagine public education as an excellent, efficient and equitable pillar of American society. During this time, Success Academies has grown faster than any charter network in the nation, building a vibrant network of 53 elementary, middle and high schools. Our 20,000 children – mostly low income and minority – are out-performing students at top city and suburban schools across New York State. Looking forward, our goals are even more ambitious: to grow to 100 schools and to educate 50,000 children across New York City in a uniquely holistic K-12 system, bringing transformational change here and across the country through extraordinary school quality.


As part of our path to achieve that ambition, we embrace a data-driven approach to problem solving, and expect our team members to have command over the details of their programs and outcomes. To support these needs, we are seeking an analytics enthusiast to join our team as a data analyst.


This individual will report on and analyze Key Performance Indicators across SA’s Elementary, Middle and High Schools, and will use data to evaluate educational programs, processes and policies. You will collaborate closely with analysts and engineers on the Enterprise Data and Analytics team, translating the outcomes required of the Schooling department, and co-building plans for using data inputs and analysis to accomplish our goals.


Key responsibilities include:

Deeply understand and define the universe of data that needs to be tracked across the Schooling department.

Establish how new metrics will be defined and measured, and partner with business teams to operationalize reporting.

Manage the data for Schooling large-scale projects (e.g. Teacher Performance Evaluations, KPI Reporting, Pay Structures) and consult with stakeholders to make improvements in processes

Deliver analytics and insights that are clear and digestible to non-technical stakeholders.

Conduct rigorous quality assurance to ensure accuracy and integrity of data.

Produce Schooling department dashboards and data visualizations.

Conduct ad-hoc analyses to gain understanding of relationships between school and scholar level variables to develop insights on which to build recommendations.

Collaborate with Enterprise Data and Analytics engineers and analysts to migrate data and build visualizations, sophisticated dashboards, and predictive analytics.


We can’t wait to meet you if you have the following experiences and mindsets:


Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree

Minimum 2 years of experience in the field of data organization, validation, and visualization

Fluency in expressing analytics needs, capabilities, and outcomes

Experience working with BI and data visualization platforms

Expertise in manipulating large data sets and interpreting trends

Ability to communicate complex information with clarity and precision

Is an eager and quick learner who seeks out constructive feedback

Places high value on ownership with meticulous attention to detail

Effectively collaborates with a broad base of constituents at all levels, including senior organizational leadership


Preferred Qualifications & Traits

Experience working within reporting and data visualization tools (SQL preferred)

Understanding of student information systems and other educational technologies

Strong strategic thinking, communication, project management, and problem-solving skills


What we offer:

A engagement-focused and high performance-oriented culture

Continuous learning and development opportunities

A flexible hybrid work environment that allows you to work on-site and from home within the NYC metropolitan area

Mission-driven work that changes the lives of kids across New York City

A robust benefits package including medical, dental and vision insurance options; a 403(b) retirement plan with company matching

Compensation Range

Exact compensation may vary based on skills and experience.
